page.title: 01North Holwell Sherborne
page.content: With its scattered farms set amidst gently undulating countryside & a maturing vineyard on one of its southern slopes, the spreading meadows of this part of the Blackmore Vale lead the eye, as in a constable painting, to the mediaeval church town rising above its clustering hamlet. Is is a countryside relatively empty, whose blacksmith, quarryman & brickmaker among others have gone, together with their convivial ale-houses & thronging chapels: only the established church maintains a token presence, its parsons' ministrations appointed over several parishes. Exodus or Diaspora if you like, occasioned by those mechanised houses, at first so warmly welcomed, who now being in the commuter or owner of a second home, itself often a converted farm or cottage. For those
